description: Lesley Stahl and a 60 Minutes team sheltered in a bunker during a drone attack on an Israeli border town that has increasingly come under fire from Hezbollah militants.
title: Reporting on the battle with Hezbollah in Metula, Israel

description: Christopher Ahn says he helped North Koreans defect as a volunteer with activist group Cheollima Civil Defense. Now he's facing criminal charges — and possibly assassination — after a mission gone wrong.
title: Veteran faces charges after he says he tried to help North Koreans defect

description: A U.S. Marine veteran says he was part of a failed fake kidnapping plot designed to help North Koreans in Spain defect. He's facing charges in Spain, where he believes he is at risk of assassination.
title: Veteran faces assassination threat after plan to help North Koreans defect

description: Amid heightened tensions with the U.S. over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Israel is continuing its war with Hamas in Gaza. It's also facing the Iran-backed Hezbollah to the north.
title: U.S., Israel "drifting apart," former head of Israeli army intelligence says

description: Israel, preparing for a possible Rafah invasion, faces increased tension with the U.S. over the Gaza humanitarian crisis. To the north, it's also confronting Hezbollah attacks coming in from Lebanon.
title: Israel preparing for Rafah invasion in Gaza amid increasing tension with U.S.

description: To understand why American Christopher Ahn risked his life to help North Korean diplomats defect — and why North Koreas may want to surrender their own homeland — we turned to some of 60 Minutes' decades-long coverage of North Korea.
title: 60 Minutes Archive: Coverage of North Korea

description: Israel, preparing for a possible Rafah invasion, faces increased tension with the U.S. over the Gaza humanitarian crisis. To the north, it’s also confronting Hezbollah attacks coming in from Lebanon.
title: Israel faces Iranian-backed Hamas to the south and Hezbollah to the north | 60 Minutes

description: A U.S. Marine veteran says he was part of a failed fake kidnapping plot designed to help North Koreans in Spain defect. He’s facing charges in Spain, where he believes he is at risk of assassination.
title: Marine veteran explains alleged fake kidnapping plot to help North Koreans defect

description: Pope Francis will sit down with 60 Minutes next Sunday for a wide-ranging and exceedingly rare conversation from his Vatican guest house home. Norah O'Donnell reports.
title: Pope Francis to sit down with 60 Minutes

description: Lesley Stahl and a 60 Minutes team sheltered in a bunker during a drone attack on an Israeli border town that has increasingly come under fire from Hezbollah militants.
title: Reporting on the battle with Hezbollah in Metula, Israel

description: In 2003, Mike Wallace reported on North Korea, a country rarely visited by foreigners, where people lived in abject poverty, and disease and malnutrition were rampant.
title: North Korea (2003) | 60 Minutes Archive

description: In 2004, Mike Wallace spoke to a Dutch reporter, who saw firsthand how North Korea was using "The Diary of a Young Girl" — the chronicle of Anne Frank, to teach students to fear and hate America.
title: Lost in Translation (2004) | 60 Minutes Archive

description: In 2005, Scott Pelley spoke with Charles Robert Jenkins, a former U.S. soldier who had deserted to North Korea in 1965, about the abuse and control he suffered over his nearly 40 years there.
title: 39 Years, 6 Months, 4 Days (2005) | 60 Minutes Archive

description: In 2017, Bill Whitaker reported on the continuing military threat posed by North Korea, a threat exacerbated by dictator Kim Jong-un's possession of nuclear weapons and his pursuit of an intercontinental ballistic missile.
title: The North Korean threat (2017) | 60 Minutes Archive

description: The Punxsutawney Groundhog Club Inner Circle announced on Facebook that two names had finally been chosen for Phil and his wife Phyllis' new babies, who were born in March.​​
title: Punxsutawney Groundhog Club reveals Phil and Phyllis' new babies' names

description: The Kremlin on Sunday said Vladimir Putin has signed a decree appointing Sergei Shoigu as secretary of Russia's national security council, replacing Nikolai Patrushev.
title: Putin appoints Shoigu as secretary of Russia's national security council

description: Jerry Seinfeld, who has supported Israel since the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants, delivered the commencement address at Duke University on Sunday.
title: Duke graduates walk out ahead of Jerry Seinfeld's commencement address

description: Zahra Skaik, a 44-year-old Palestinian woman living in Gaza City, escaped the war thanks to her American sons.
title: How a group of veterans helped a U.S. service member's mother get out of war-torn Gaza

description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Sen. Tom Cotton join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation," May 12, 2024

description: This week on "Face the Nation," Secretary of State Antony Blinken joins Margaret Brennan as America's relationship with Israel faces a serious stress test this week, with a new U.S. report that says it is “reasonable to assess” that Israel violated international law in its war with Hamas. Plus, a story about how a group of special operations veterans helped a fellow service member's family get their mother out of war-torn Gaza.
title: 5/12: Face the Nation

description: Zahra Skaik, a 44-year-old Palestinian woman living in Gaza City, escaped the war thanks to her sons – one of whom is an infantryman in the U.S. army. Margaret Brennan sat down with Skaik recently as she described how she left Gaza with nothing but a small backpack and the same clothes she had been wearing since the war began.
title: How a group of veterans helped a U.S. service member's mother get out of war-torn Gaza

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on...Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas tells "Face the Nation" that it is different from actions taken by President Ronald Reagan in the 1980s." "Israel is fighting a war of survival against a terrorist group that committed the worst atrocity against Jews since World War II," he added, Democratic Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland tells "Face the Nation" that the Biden administration has set a "very low bar for what's acceptable" from Israel in a report on that country's use of U.S. weapons in the war against Hamas, and Zahra Skaik, a 44-year-old Palestinian woman living in Gaza City, escaped the war thanks to her sons – one of whom is an infantryman in the U.S. army. Margaret Brennan sat down with Skaik recently as she described how she left Gaza with nothing but a small backpack and the same clothes she had been wearing since the war began.
title: Face the Nation: Cotton, Van Hollen

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. "will not support" an Israeli military operation in the southern city of Rafah without a "credible plan to protect civilians."
title: Blinken says U.S. won't back Rafah incursion without "credible plan" to protect civilians

description: Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas, who has been fiercely critical of the Biden administration's decision to pause a weapons shipment to Israel, tells "Face the Nation" that it is different from actions taken by President Ronald Reagan in the 1980s." "Israel is fighting a war of survival against a terrorist group that committed the worst atrocity against Jews since World War II," he added.
title: Sen. Tom Cotton says Israel is "fighting a war for survival against a terrorist group"

description: Thousands more civilians have fled Russia's renewed ground offensive in Ukraine's northeast that has targeted towns and villages with a barrage of artillery and mortar fire.
title: Thousands flee as Russia presses border assault in northeast Ukraine

description: Democratic Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland tells "Face the Nation" that the Biden administration has set a "very low bar for what's acceptable" from Israel in a report on that country's use of U.S. weapons in the war against Hamas. "With respect to the delivery of humanitarian assistance, and the total restriction of delivery of humanitarian assistance since the beginning of the war - by not calling that out flatly and saying that there have been arbitrary restrictions put on it, I fear that we have set a very, very low bar," he said.
title: Sen. Chris Van Hollen says White House has a "very low bar for what's acceptable" from Israel

description: Authorities are searching for a suspect accused of fatally shooting a 23-year-old police officer in Euclid, Ohio, on Saturday night.
title: Ohio officer fatally shot after being "ambushed" by gunman, authorities say

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sen. Chris Van Hollen, Democrat of Maryland, that aired on May 12, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. Chris Van Hollen on "Face the Nation," May 12, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sen. Tom Cotton, Republican of Arkansas, that aired on May 12, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. Tom Cotton on "Face the Nation," May 12, 2024

description: Ahead of Mother's Day, actor and singer Julie Andrews and her daughter Emma Walton Hamilton sit down with Jane Pauley to discuss their latest children's book "Waiting in the Wings." Then, Lilia Luciano travels to Colombia to see where so many of the cut flowers imported into the U.S. are grown. "Here Comes the Sun" is a closer look at some of the people, places and things we bring you every week on "CBS Sunday Morning."
title: Here Comes the Sun: Julie Andrews and more

description: People from the United States and Canada to the United Kingdom, Poland, parts of China and Russia saw the northern lights this weekend.
title: Spectacular photos show the northern lights around the world

description: Following President Biden's confirmation that the U.S. will not send weapons to Israel if there is an invasion of Rafah, Secretary of State Antony Blinken confirmed on "Face the Nation" that the U.S. "will not support" Israel if there is a "major military operation" in Rafah in the "absence of a credible plan to protect civilians."
title: Blinken says U.S. won't back Rafah incursion without "credible plan" to protect civilians

description: This week on "Face the Nation," Secretary of State Antony Blinken joins Margaret Brennan as America's relationship with Israel faces a serious stress test this week, with a new U.S. report that says it is "reasonable to assess" that Israel violated international law in its war with Hamas. Plus, a story about how a group of special operations veterans helped a fellow service member's family get their mother out of war-torn Gaza.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," May 12, 2024

description: The Cannes Film Festival rarely passes without cacophony but this year's edition may be more raucous and uneasy than any edition in recent memory.
title: Cannes set to unfurl against backdrop of war, protests and films

description: We leave you this Sunday morning with mustangs at the Black Hills Wild Horse Sanctuary in South Dakota. Videographer: Kevin Kjergaard.
title: Nature: Mustangs in South Dakota

description: For Peggy Means of Dowagiac, Mich., Mother's Day was just another "X" on the calendar, just another day without her daughter, Jennifer, who in 2017 was critically injured in a car crash before slipping into a coma. But Means refused to let doctors take Jennifer off life support. Steve Hartman reports on why Means finally can celebrate Mother's Day.
title: A mother's love, returned

description: The host of the HBO series "Real Time," and author of the new book, "What This Comedian Said Will Shock You," doesn't discriminate between right and left when aiming his barbs at tribal politics.
title: Bill Maher on not pulling punches

description: Comedian Bill Maher, host of the HBO series "Real Time," doesn't discriminate between right and left when aiming his barbs at tribal politics. He talks with CBS News chief election & campaign correspondent Robert Costa about gladly courting controversy, whether by mocking politicians or inviting them to his show. He also discusses his new book, "What This Comedian Said Will Shock You."
title: Bill Maher on humor in politics: "Don't be tribal"

description: Correspondent Faith Salie reports on fashion's biggest night, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute Benefit, where designs ranged from artful flowers to artfully positioned sand.
title: Fashion double-takes from the Met Gala

description: After 14 days, Johns Hopkins University and student protesters reached an agreement on the dismantling and conclusion of the protest-related encampment on the Beach at the Homewood campus.
title: Johns Hopkins University and student protesters agree to end encampment

description: A new movie dramatizes the life and music of the charismatic British singer whose struggles with drugs and alcohol led to her death at age 27. Director Sam Taylor-Johnson and actress Marisa Abela describe capturing a complex life on film.
title: How biopic "Back to Black" puts Amy Winehouse "right back in the center of her story"

description: A new movie dramatizes the life and music of British singer Amy Winehouse, the charismatic, multiple-Grammy-winner whose struggles with drugs and alcohol led to her death at the age of 27. Correspondent Seth Doane talks with director Sam Taylor-Johnson about capturing a complex life on film; and with actress Marisa Abela, who describes how she inhabited the role of Winehouse from the inside out.
title: "Back to Black": The life of Amy Winehouse

description: Just in time for Mother's Day, filmmaker Josh Seftel catches up with his mom, Pat, for some timely advice on the holiday.
title: Josh Seftel's mom on the perfect Mother's Day

description: In 2001, 60 Minutes reported on "mammoni," Italian mama's boys who, well into adulthood, lived at home, slept in their childhood bedrooms, and were waited on by their mothers. At the time, one 39-year-old called the set-up "paradiso."
title: "Mammoni" | 60 Minutes Archive

description: He's the most prolific fashion designer you've never heard of, and while he may not be a household name, Stan Herman has dressed millions of households, and has also designed uniforms for a multitude of companies, from TWA and Avis to McDonald's and FedEx. Correspondent Alina Cho talks with the 95-year-old Herman, who recently recounted his extraordinary career in the memoir, "Uncross Your Legs: A Life in Fashion."
title: Meet Stan Herman, elder statesman of American fashion

description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the notable figures who left us this week, including "B-movie" director Roger Corman, whose production company helped launch the careers of such filmmakers as Francis Ford Coppola, Martin Scorsese and James Cameron.
title: Passage: In memoriam

description: The blaze in northeastern British Columbia started Friday and almost doubled in size by the following day, reaching about 4,200 acres.
title: Thousands of Canadians forced to evacuate as massive wildfire burns

description: The actress, starring in the comedy-drama "Appropriate," talks about how her mother helped set the stage for her dream of acting; and why she still hasn't watched herself in "American Crime Story: The People vs. O.J. Simpson."
title: Tony-nominee Sarah Paulson: "If this is a dream, I don't wanna wake up"

description: A look back at the hallowed career of the indie "B-movie" filmmaker, known for exploitation films, monster flicks, and some bizarre movie posters.
title: Roger Corman, "King of the B Movies" 1926-2024

description: Emmy-winning actress Sarah Paulson has been nominated for a Tony Award for her performance in the comedy-drama "Appropriate," about siblings torn apart by unearthed secrets. She talks with correspondent Tracy Smith about how her mother accommodated Paulson's passion for acting, and why she still hasn't watched herself in "American Crime Story:" The People vs. O.J. Simpson."
title: Tony-nominee Sarah Paulson on "Appropriate"

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Secretary of State Antony Blinken that aired on May 12, 2024.
title: Transcript: Secretary of State Antony Blinken on "Face the Nation," May 12, 2024

description: With the hit series wrapping after seven seasons, "Sunday Morning" talks with star Iain Armitage; Jim Parsons (who created the character of Sheldon Cooper on "The Big Bang Theory"); and producers Steve Molaro and Steve Holland, about the family comedy's success.
title: Saying goodbye to "Young Sheldon"

description: Iain Armitage, star of the CBS comedy "Young Sheldon," has pulled off a magic trick: helping carry a network TV hit for seven seasons while also growing up. Luke Burbank talks with the young actor about the show's finale; and with Jim Parsons (who created the character of Sheldon Cooper on "The Big Bang Theory") and executive producers Steve Molaro and Steve Holland about the show's success, which has surprised even them.
title: Iain Armitage on the final season of "Young Sheldon"

description: They may not have much fragrance, but they look startlingly real and will never wilt or fade. Correspondent Conor Knighton talks with artists who create pristine peonies and pansies, life-like lilacs, and ridiculously large roses, using little more than paper, paint and glue.
title: See stunning paper floral displays

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: May 12

description: Victims of the devastating floods in northern Afghanistan are burying the dead and looking for the loved ones still missing.
title: Flash floods in northern Afghanistan leave hundreds dead and missing

description: Everywhere you look, products are getting too complicated, with more and more features aimed at attracting consumers. For designers, it's a constant and complex balance to get it just right.
title: Why does product design sometimes fail? It's complicated

description: Everywhere you look, products are getting too complicated, with more and more features aimed at attracting consumers. But designing things to do more can often lead to frustrated and unhappy customers. For designers, it's a constant and complex balance to get it just right. Correspondent David Pogue looks at how complicated lives – full of endless features – may be getting easier to navigate thanks to technology.
title: What happened to "simple" design?

description: A remarkable judge of talent, Corman hired such aspiring filmmakers as Francis Ford Coppola, Ron Howard, James Cameron and Martin Scorsese.
title: Roger Corman, trailblazing independent film producer, dies at 98

description: From mariachi serenades to visits to local churches to shared meals, here's how people around the globe honor the family matriarch on Mother's Day.
title: Mother's Day traditions differ across the world — see how other families celebrate

description: The Denver Nuggets face the Minnesota Timberwolves for Game 4 of the teams' NBA Playoffs series tonight.
title: How to watch the Denver Nuggets vs. Minnesota Timberwolves game tonight: Game 4 livestream options, more

description: Here's how and when to watch Game 4 of the New York Knicks vs. Indiana Pacers NBA Playoffs series today.
title: How to watch the New York Knicks vs. Indiana Pacers NBA Playoffs game today: Game 4 livestream options

description: The Canucks and Oilers meet again for Game 3 of the NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs. Here's how and when to watch.
title: How to watch the Vancouver Canucks vs. Edmonton Oilers NHL Playoffs game tonight: Game 3 livestream options, more

description: When her mother disappears, 7-year-old Nicki Bates begins a lifelong search to find her and bring her killer to justice. "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports.
title: The Day My Mother Vanished

description: A woman outwits a young stranger who attacked her in her own home. What will it take to find him? "48 Hours" contributor Jim Axelrod reports.
title: A Stabbing in Colts Neck

description: Israel orders new Rafah evacuations; San Francisco's iconic Top of the Mark celebrates 85th anniversary
title: 5/11: CBS Weekend News

description: Nearly two decades after an intoxicated and half naked William Greer confessed to killing Tammy Myers, her daughter is determined to see her mother's killer brought to justice.
title: Search for Texas mom's remains continues 17 years after shooting death

description: The armed suspect died during the encounter, police said.
title: 3 Atlanta police officers shot after responding to call about armed man

description: After being stabbed in the face, neck and chest, Donna Ongsiako mustered the strength to climb up a staircase, call 911 and describe her unlikely attacker for investigators.
title: How a woman, left for dead, survived a violent home invasion

description: Kennedy said he now supports abortions up until the point of fetal viability.
title: RFK Jr. reverses abortion stance again after confusion, contradictions emerge

description: The Massachusetts man who received the first pig kidney transplant in the world has died.
title: Massachusetts man who received first-ever pig kidney transplant dies at 62

description: The largest geomagnetic storm in more than 20 years reached Earth Friday, and put on a northern lights show, with breathtaking images from Europe to Canada, and across much of the U.S., even as far south as Florida. Michael George reports.
title: Powerful solar storm sparks stunning display of northern lights across the globe

description: Black voters helped swing Georgia for President Biden in the 2020 election, but their support appears to be softening, and local grassroots organizers are seeing signs Black men are particularly slow to return to his fold. Taurean Small explains the challenges faced by the campaign.
title: Biden campaign seeks to strengthen its support among Black men
